titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Rockefeller University records, Site Development FA849

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-11-01 03:18:40 -0400.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Building blueprints; architectural drawings, plot plans, design drawings and campus maps.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Shepley, Rutan and Coolidge were the architects for the Central Laboratory (now called Founders) which was built on land purchased from the Schermer-horn Estate October 1902 plus an additional strip given to the Institute in 1904. The building was completed for occupancy May 11, 1906.
York and Sawyer were the architects for the Hospital and Isolation Pavilion. The formal opening was October 17, 1910.
Coolidge and Shattuck were the architects for the Middle Laboratory (now called Flexner) and new animal house and power house completed and occupied by 1916.
Coolidge and Shattuck were the architects for the Department of Animal Pathology buildings in Princeton, New Jersey which were completed in 1916.

Coolidge, Shepley, Bulfinch and Abbott (changed from Coolidge and Shattuck July 1, 1924) were the architects for the library, assembly hall (now Welch Hall) and tunnel changes in New York City as well as the new laboratory and and animal building for the Department of Animal Pathology in Princeton which were opened 1928-1929.
Coolidge, Shepley, Bulfinch and Abbott were the architects for the North Laboratory (now called Smith Hall), a low unit for combined laboratory and animal purposes, 1928-1930.
Coolidge, Shepley, Bulfinch and Abbott submitted between 1930-1934 various plot plans and proposals for alterations.
Coolidge, Shepley, Bulfinch and Abbott were the architects for the Plant Pathology buildings completed at Princeton in 1932.
James Mfg. Co. and Matthews Construction Co. were responsible for Dr. Wade Brown's laboratory completed at Princeton department in November 1935.

Coolidge, Shepley, Bulfinch and Abbott were the architects and the builders were Vermilya -Brown Co. for the Plant Pathology buildings built 1947-1949 in New York City preparing for departmental move from Princeton.

Coolidge, Shepley, Bulfinch and Abbott were the architects and Vermyla-Brown were the builders for the construction of a new wing and the modernization of the Hospital. Work was done between 1949-1951.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of the RAC. Oversize material may necessitate special viewing arrangements be made.

did.unittitle: Coolidge, Shepley, Bulfinch and Abbott building plans for Hospital. Designed and revised 1930-1934 for proposed additions and alterations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes blueprints, floor by floor; compilations of floor potions; drawings of elevations and of exterior. Scheme "C" primarily.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Due to the oversize nature and potential brittle condition of the contents of this collection, special arrangements may be required in order to view materials. Individual items may be restricted due to preservation concerns.
